Yup. Mix and match some combination of these:

Q: some form of poke with some attached CC
W or E: heal or shield
E or W: slow or ally buff
R: ult that deals minimal damage but packs serious CC

I welcome a support who does something different.

I'm willing to bet Riot only considers any new interest in playing Support due to Pyke to be just a decent side-effect of their main intentions.

As they did with Rakan, Riot wanted to try and design something for the Support space that hadn't been done before - in Rakan's case, an agile, in-and-out Diver-Enchanter who really shook up the balance of immobile Enchanters and somewhat-mobile Tanks.

In Pyke's case, it's pretty clear what Riot saw was missing from the Support roster. We've got heavy Tanks that soak damage, Enchanters who provide buffs and healing, and Mages who provide damage and lockdown...But no Champions to play for those who want to be vicious and murder the fuck out of people. No genuine "kill Supports".

Every other Kill Support has just been adapted from other lanes - Zoe, Veigar, Pantheon, etc. - so a genuine, built-for-Support Kill Support was something they very clearly wanted to bring. So, they brought it.

Rakan was well designed.  He is Strong but not OP

Pyke looks to have all the strong parts of other champs in his whole kit....

P: {{champion:223}} P
Q: {{champion:53}} {{champion:50}} Q and E
W: {{champion:28}} P
E: {{champion:39}} E
R: {{champion:122}}  R

That sort of over-simplification only hurts the ability to actually look at and understand the Champion. It's like when Galio was reworked, and people only looked at _Hero's Entrance_ and spent the entirety of the PBE cycle going "It's just a better/shittier version of Shen".

Besides, you're ignoring the larger mechanical differences between each of the abilities you listed (some of which, by the way, aren't even remotely accurate)

Tahm Kench's passive isn't his Gray Health. That would be his E, _Thick Skin_. His Passive is _An Acquired Taste_, which allows him to stack up _Acquired Taste_ on a Champion to augment/allow his abilities.

Beyond that, though, while _Gift of the Drowned Ones_ is ostensibly just the passive half of _Thick Skin_ (Gray Health conversion), it requires that Pyke not be seen by enemies to allow the healing conversion to happen.

_Bone Skewer_ (Harpoon) is less akin to Blitzcrank's _Rocket Grab_ and more like a mix of Varus' _Piercing Arrow_ and Taliyah's _Seismic Shove_. It requires charging, and it will only throw a target a set distance in Pyke's direction - at max range, it would draw them into, say, basic attack range, but at point-blank, it will work more like Singed's _Fling_, tossing an enemy behind him.

(which, is why I used _Seismic Shove_ as the primary reference for it, as it's a skillshot and the distance thrown is based on positioning.)

_Bone Skewer_ (Dagger)...I don't see how you relate it to Swain's _Nevermove_. _Nevermove_ doesn't slow, and it roots on the way back. _Bone Skewer_ is more akin to a mix of Yasuo's _Steel Tempest_ (non-empowered) and Darius' _Cripple_. It's a line skillshot thrust that deals damage and applies a heavy slow.

_Ghostwater Dive_ is less like Evelynn's _Demon Shade_ and more like Twitch's _Ambush_, sans attack speed steroid and reset, and with diminishing movespeed.

_Phantom Undertow_ is more like Shen's _Shadow Dash_ + _Twilight Assault_ combo, except the image moving triggers the stun and does so on its own. Even still, that's a pretty bad attempt at describing it, but it's certainly more accurate than using Irelia's _Flawless Duet_.

_Death From Below_ is about the closest to accurate - it is somewhat like Darius' _Noxian Guillotine_, but also _not_ like it at the same time. It's an AoE Skillshot that you can actually dodge, and the execute is less based on stacks (like Darius' _Hemorrhage_) and more reliant on an execute threshold (like Evelynn's _Last Caress_).

Even still, likening his abilities to other Champion abilities only detracts from the ability to understand Pyke's kit, especially when those example Champions are all over the place in role (Varus as a bottom laner, Taliyah and Swain as mid laners, Shen and Darius as Top laners, Tahm Kench and Blitzcrank as Supports...Etc.)

When we look at new Champions (or VGU's), we should only look at Champions abilities as being similar to others _as a point of reference for understanding how to use them_, not as a point of reference to infer their role.

Pyke is a Support-Assassin. He has some of the advantages and disadvantages of Assassins (high mobility, stealth, burst damage, but very lightweight and easy to kill) with those of Supports (Crowd control, ability to complement or uplift a given teammate, utility, but lack of extra ability without a teammate).
Sorry, don't mean to be petty, but Tahm's E is the thick skin

Correcting me is anything but petty. Thanks for it, by the way - I've edited my response accordingly.

When i posted this, i instantly regretted it because i knew people would come in with the usual "PYKE IS FUKIN OP" and thats not what this post was meant to be, im just a distraught support main who felt like the support role got "zed'd" with this champ release.   A sort of, if you dont want to play support unless youre getting kills, dont play support at all, type of thing.   Kind of undermines the whole role.


Even though i have to admit its probably going to be a good release, decently balanced in a month or two, and triple kills wont come as frequently as imagined.

That's fair. I don't expect Pyke will shake up the Support roster too awful much, but, I think some of the main issues regarding Pyke is that people have some strict views about what Supports do. From the way I understand it, the largest point of conflict comes from the fact that people expect Supports to allow their Carries/Bot lanes/whomever to get the majority of the kills and live vicariously through their carries.

And, as it stands, an Assassin playstyle undermines that expectation by a large margin. I think the "Supports allowing kills" mindset may wind up reinforced due to the Shutdown Gold changes soon, but, I personally think (especially in some cases) that Supports getting their fair share of kill gold and XP can be beneficial. (it sucks to always be one or two items behind your team, after all).

---

All that community supposition aside, though, I think it'd also help to do some supposition of Riot's possible motives for this. I mentioned in my initial response to your post that I felt Riot wanted to diversify Support playstyles by adding an Assassin, much like how they added Rakan as a Diver - but, there's another potential reason for it.

Opening everyone up to new playstyles. Whether it's helping introduce Supports to Assassins/Divers whatever other role, or giving people from various other parts of the map (like top lane, jungle, mid) an opportunity to squeeze their way into a role they otherwise wouldn't want to play.

I can understand frustration when your favorite role gets shaken up by new releases or new content, but, hopefully things will unfold in a good way, if not in the way Riot (may) expect it to.

As someone who has hit level 7 on every support in the game outside of Lulu and Braum, I welcome this new champ with open arms. I like to do full AP Bard and when I jungle I tend to play assassins. I personally don't see this as an attempt to make people come play support, but as an attempt to make a unique champion unlike any other for the role. Let's face it, lots of supports have kits that fulfill very similar goals and the ones who are super unique (Bard, Rakan, Thresh to a lesser extent) are all super utility based.

I've been wanting an AD support since season 1 and this is a dream come true for me. The reason Riot has made all the supports either supertanks or AP damage is because an AD support would make the enemy bot just build armor to counter both players, so it makes sense the damage types were split. Pyke on the other hand builds full damage instead of stopping for support item purchases, allowing him to snowball him and his AD way ahead to stay ahead of the armor. I think the design is great and any AD support would have to be a full damage assassin for the reasons I just explained, plus it just puts a unique spin on the game. He's gonna be insane if he gets ahead and I'm excited to play him.

Even that could be better use for a jungler. Instead of giving kills to one person, they could spread them around
